FuncDef:
The dhcpv6 option-18 rebuild self-define send-to-server command enables a device to insert the self-defined Option 18 attribute into a Relay-forward message to be sent to the DHCPv6 server.
The undo dhcpv6 option-18 rebuild self-define send-to-server command disables the function.
By default, a device is disabled from inserting the Option 18 attribute into a Relay-forward message to be sent to the DHCPv6 server based on the self-defined OSP format.
CLIs: undo dhcpv6 option-18 rebuild self-define <self-define-value> send-to-server

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a user-defined Option 18 attribute (interface ID), which carries access location information.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 characters.

Examples: [~HUAWEI-Eth-Trunk100.21-bas] dhcpv6 option-18 rebuild self-define HUAWEI send-to-server
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When IPv6 addresses are assigned from a remote IPv6 address pool, the device is disabled from inserting the self-defined Option 18 attribute into a Relay-forward message to be sent to the DHCPv6 server by default. To enable the device to insert the self-defined Option 18 attribute into a Relay-forward message to be sent to the DHCPv6 server, run the dhcpv6 option-18 rebuild self-define send-to-server command. After this command is run, the device inserts the Option 18 attribute based on the following format:
Format of the Option 18 attribute: interface description:outer VLAN ID.inner VLAN ID
Interface description (interface ID) supports self-defined character strings.
Configuration Impact
The dhcpv6 option-18 rebuild self-define send-to-server command takes effect in real time. The contents of the Option 18 attribute inserted in the Relay-forward messages sent to the DHCPv6 server are different before and after the configurations are added or deleted.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
The dhcpv6 option-18 rebuild self-define send-to-server command is configured in the BAS interface view, whereas the dhcpv6 relay option-insert interface-id mode { cn-telecom | tr-101 } and dhcpv6 relay option-insert mode type1 commands are configured in the interface view. If the commands configured in the two views are both run, the command configured in the BAS interface view takes effect.
